Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad”
Reviews.Author: Tim D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reasonable value for money. Staff were very good but the room felt like they needed a bit of updating. Would not put anyone off staying here.Breafast a bit basic for 10Euros each, woul davise going out for Breakfast. The overall area of the hotel is very good, with good tram access.

Reviews.Title: “WOW LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emma b
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner have just returned from a weekend stay at the NL hotel, booked by my sister as a treat! Well all I can say is what an amazing place!!! The hotel has just undergone complete refurbishment and was absolutely beautiful, the staff and owner made us feel very welcome and nothing was to much trouble. It is in a great location, within easy reach of everything Amsterdam has to offer. I would not hesitate booking this hotel again and recommending this to all!!!!! I will definitely be back...............

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadia-rose1989
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just come home from a 2 night stay here. Lovely small hotel very clean and helpful staff. We stayed in the basement rooms are small yet are liveable with a very comfy bed! We had an amazing first time experience in amsterdam. We would recommend anne franks house, diamond factory, the bulldog coffee shops and this hotel. Its a 15 min walk to the dam central and 5 mins to leidensplien were there are many resturants bars and coffee shops!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: I booked NL Hotel as part of a surprise trip for my wife's birthday. The hotel was lovely, the staff couldn't be more helpful - Susan was particularly friendly and informative. The room was compact, but well laid out, the bed was truly comfortable and the room was beautifully clean. The location of the hotel put it in easy reach of all that Amsterdam had to offer. We had a fabulous weekend and this hotel was a significant factor.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: antokr
Reviews.Content: In the same area you cannot find nothing better with the same price...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..”
Reviews.Author: Brosdeli
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, clean, modern and tidy. Very well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew O
Reviews.Content: Great location near everything. However the hotel needs some renovation in the rooms. Nice clean hotel, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: jesse v
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel during our trip to Amsterdam. It's a quality hotel. The location is superb, the service was good and the staff was very helpful, we were always given good advice on which places to visit and so on. The rooms are quite small and cosy but they're very luxurious. Over all a great experience and I recommended it to others visiting Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: wavecatcher28
Reviews.Content: Wow, clean, warm, safe and absolute style. I loved the decorating style of the botique with simple clean lines very tranquill deco. The staff were outstanding and when I needed a computer they offered me a little lap top with internet. Gosh, when I needed coffee (I could drink as many cups) or ice or fruit all I had to do was ask. I had an awesome room a with a very relaxing patio in the back. It was in short walking distance from the centre, the staff were happy to help when I need directions and I could also appreciate the canals and wonderful buildings. If I go back to Amsterdam this will be the ideal place to go, ideal for a short city break. I can't rave on about it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamie55Nottingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NL hotel for a weekend Birthday treat. A very stylish hotel. A great location. Overlooks a quiet canal yet is only a few minutes from the Leidseplein entertainment area, with a good choice of eateries,bars and shopping. You can get to the museum area in a short walk. There are several different tram routes close by to get to other parts of the city with little effort. The rooms have modern decoration and are well equipped. Ours had a great shower and access to a large, decked private seating area. Given the time of year we didn't use it much but would be great in summer. Like most small hotels in traditional buildings in central Amsterdam the rooms are small but well laid out, making good use of space so didn't feel too cramped. We would use the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: JuanPigot
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in Amsterdam for 2 nights. The location of the hotel is great. Rooms are a big small-ish but beautiful decoration. We were staying in a room in the cellar under the lobby. Tents to be a bit noisy in the morning during breakfast. Our room was below street level so in the morning the noise of the cars is a bit loud. The service is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “thank you NL Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mae_rebekah
Reviews.Content: The NL Hotel was a wonderful experience from start to finish, staff were so kind and went beyond what was expected from run of the mill concierge. The hotel is small like all accom in Amsterdam but didn't feel pokey and again the wonderful staff were always available to help out with any needs or requests, clean, good breaky and just an all over great time, we will definitely return x x neeeederlands rocks xxx

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, fantastic location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Time T
Reviews.Content: NL Amsterdam (in Leidseplein area) is a charming, boutique, modern hotel in a heritage Dutch architecture, facing one of the many romantic canals in Amsterdam. Staff were fantastic and helpful. Design of rooms are stylish and functional - although the size of rooms are on the small side, they manage to fit everything you need in a small area and yet feel comfortable. Keep in mind this hotel doesn't have elevators, and it has very steep staircase (common in Amsterdam). But the staff is ready to help you. Location is as good as you can get - it is central (only 2 blocks from Leidseplein and Jordaan) yet far away enough from the noise. Lots of fantastic restaurants everywhere. Must try the original Dutch pancakes with ice cream - it's heavenly. Want to see the traditional Dutch windmill which you won't find in the city? Go to Zaanse Schans. Simply take one of the GVB trams (#1, #2 or #5) from Leiseplein to Central Station. Then bus # 91 directly (takes about 40 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean with all mod cons”
Reviews.Author: SophiaWitney
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 2 night stay at the NL Hotel, despite struggling with the very steep stairs to our room (I know this is usual in Amsterdam!) Staff could not have been more helpful & having a room at the back made it very peaceful. The rooms are small but you have everything you need & I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amstel”
Reviews.Author: IVANA L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3 nights and all is wonderfull, the hotel staff very helpfull and friendly, the hotel is situated close to the Center and Jordaans and deserves really its reputation (I saw other reviews mostly positive) in a very calm zone; you can visit all the museums around by walk and if you need a tramway the stop is at Leidsplain close to the hotel. The canal trips are also available a few steps from the hotel; we also booked an I Amsterdam Card which helped us to save the money - all the musem's entries are free and public transportations too, some shops and restaurants are giving you gifts or allowing discounts for Card holders. A very nice surprise at the hotel is a Nespresso machine in the room so comfortable !

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: gregcmorley
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked three nights at the hotel and based on the recommendations on Trip Advisor and were looking forward to a great stay at the NL Hotel. We checked out after only one night. The room noise was so loud and disruptive causing us the poorest sleep during two weeks in Europe. The noise coming from the breakfast area in the morning was enough to rattle you out of bed early. We also found the room to be very dirty. There was dust everywhere, the area under the bed looked as if it had not been cleaned in the recent past, there was hair wrapped around the dust on the leaves of the dying plant and the bathroom was moldy. Upon checkout and through follow up the hotel has been adamant that they do not issue refunds for checking out earlier than the original reservation. This is understandable if the room is of the quality advertised. This hotel is not. We have been offered one free night at a partner hotel in Amsterdam. I can not imagine staying with this hotel again nor am I able to fly back any time soon from Hong Kong. We move the the Hotel V for the last two nights of our stay. It was super and lower priced than NL. Save yourself a forced relocation during your stay in Amsterdam and avoid NL Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Started with promise”
Reviews.Author: Jenalg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and the rooms have been nicely done. We were on the same floor as reception and woken on the last night no less than 3 occassions with other guests banging on the front door or ringing the bells constantly to get in. The quality of the beds also needs tobe reviewed ours was very soft and clearly needed to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Pvlier
Reviews.Content: We went to a concert in Paradiso. The hotel is very close to 'het Leidse Plein', so excellent location. The room was nice and modern The staff was friendly and helpfull. We definitely come back a next time, hopefully including a free breakfast ;-) Thank you NL-Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that fits me”
Reviews.Author: dressline
Reviews.Content: I came to amsterdam for pleasure and I was looking for a hotel that is nice, clean, the location is near the city centre and also the price is affordable..and I found this hotel. NL Hotel was so amazing, its boutique hotel with nice design, good service, clean, comfort, at city centre and it came with reasonable price. I love to stay here

Reviews.Title: “You should stay here for a fantastic hotel in an even better location!”
Reviews.Author: clarkey19
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from visiting Amsterdam 3 days ago, we promised ourselves we would write a review, as we read previous ones before booking. May I just stay by saying, if you want location and cleanliness this is the place to stay. We found you can walk to all the major attractions from the hotel. The main 'bar' square Leidesplein, is literally a stone throw away, it took us about 4 minutes to walk in each evening, however even longer to stagger out!! The tram (number 1, 2,5) also goes from here stright into Centraal station to the airport. As for the hotel, we found that nothing was too much bother, Hank was extremely friendly! The room we were staying in for the four nights was faantastic, had a view over the canal. There was a coffee machine in the room, however no milk, and as we were out so much, we didn't bother to buy any at Lidl, around the corner from the hotel. There were only two downsides to this hotel,the stairs to climb were steep 9but this is usually for Amsterdam) and the shower not having a door or shower curtain, as it was wet most of the day, again no major issue. You'll have a fantastic time if you stay here, all you need at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable”
Reviews.Author: silviatanji
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very charming, pleasent and clean. The location is near everything travelers need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Day_11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel! Great location just south of the Jordaan, right on the canals. Walking distance to many attractions, restaurants and city transport. The rooms were comfortable, clean and cozy. Ours looked out over the main street to the canal. I also want to mention the delicious in room espresso machine!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy&Cool”
Reviews.Author: justme017
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 day stay at the NL Hotel. Location was perfect, in a central location yet away from the crowds. We woke to birds chirping from the courtyard below our window. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful in directing us to museums and dining spots and booked us a tour to the fantastic Keukenhof Gardens for an all-day commune with the tulips! The room was small and tight with not much to accommodate hanging items, but we loved the style and design of it and shouldn't have travelled with so many clothes anyway. We will definitely return to this hotel should we be fortunate enough to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: JohnW64
Reviews.Content: from some of the reviews I read on here, we weren't sure what this hotel would be like, but we had room 13 and loved this place. very clean, very friendly staff and loved their coffee machine in the room. location was perfect, was quiet at night and right on a canal, yet only 10 minutes walk to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms but poorly insulated”
Reviews.Author: comfytraveller12
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at the base of the Jordan, this modern hotel is a nice place to stay. The rooms are an ok size but a little cramped with suitcases taking up a bit of room. If you can, request to not be in a room on the ground floor - they are right next to the reception and kitchen and the walls/doors are so thin that you can hear everything; plates clanging out of the dishwasher, people arriving back late etc. Nice range of complimentary toiletries and free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Designed for fabulousness not practicallity”
Reviews.Author: flossytrip
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel on Nov 12th for 2 nights. We went with some trepidation as we were on the ground floor and had read the reviews about it being noisy etc. We were greeted warmly with a cup of coffee and directions to wherever we wanted to go. The great thing about being on the ground floor was that there was only 1 small flight of stairs to go down. The room itself was beautifully decorated and the bed amazingly comfortable. But you could tell that the room had been designed for its fabulousness rather than practicality as the cupboards and surfaces felt a little wobbly. The room had been recently decorated and was very clean. It wasn't a huge room but my sister and I managed to not get under each others feet. If you intended on spending a lot of time in the room it may begin to feel a little bijou. As other reviewers have said there is no shower curtain, but this I believe was left out as it would have spoilt the lines of the bathroom. The sink tap was fabulous but rather impractical to use (you banged your head if you tried to wash your face so it was easier to use the bath tap). The bathroom was quite small but space was also an issue in my friends more expensive hotel. The door was glass but I believe this is quite common in that part of the world as my friends hotel also had a glass door and so did the hotel I stayed in, in Brussels. This in itself wasn't as big a problem as I expected, you just made sure you didn't put the light on in the bathroom if you were having a shower or were on the loo!! The area was much nicer that up towards Dam square, much prettier and more peaceful. Even in the hotel it was very quiet. It was about a 30 to 40 min picturesque walk from everything so we had no need to get a cab. If I visited Amsterdam again and wanted to stay on the outskirts I would definitely stay there again. The 197 bus to the airport is only a 5 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Kate874
Reviews.Content: GENERAL NL hotel is a clean & modern hotel. We paid around 400 euro for a 3 night stay in October. ROOMS The rooms are a fair size for a city hotel and bathrooms were modern but on the small side. We were on the second floor of the hotel. As it is a converted Dutch town house, the stairs would most certainly be a problem for the older / less fit traveller. We had a philips Senseo coffee maker in our room (only the upstairs rooms have this), which was fab!!! The coffee was amazing and we were able to make tea also. We bought our own milk which we kept in the fridge in the room. LOCATION The hotel is located on the Nassaukade which is quite a busy road facing a canal. The road noise was not a problem in the autumn, but could be during warmer weather when you might want to open the windows. The hotel is close to the bars and shops of the leidseplein. Have a good explore down the side streets to get the best prices for food and souveniers. STAFF We found the staff to be really helpful in general. I had e-mailed the hotel to advise them that we would be arriving at 11am and were able to take our room early. I had had a bit of a problem at Schipol - i had left my i-phone on the aircraft and the flight staff were claiming it was nowhere to be found :( Robert offered to lend us a mobile phone for our trip and provided me with a laptop to change all of my passwords to e-mail etc. BREAKFAST The breakfast offered at the hotel is 10 Euro and very simple. Although it looked good, bread, cheese and cold meats isn't my cup of tea, so we went out. ATTRACTIONS DEfinatley buy a ticket for the CANAL BUS. THe other companies are not as reliable and the price is really competitive. We also went on the pizza cruise - dominoes pizza and ben & jerrys ice cream with unlimited drinks - soft, wine, beer. Gassan diamonds is very good, the tours are very personal (my husband and i were the only people in our tour group!) and doesn't cost anything. There are many markets around Amsterdam that are well worth a visit. Souviners are much cheaper at the markets than in the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: SUIUHTB
Reviews.Content: Very much a mixed bag. Location: The hotel is located in a good location close to many of the sights and museums. Its just far enough out of the downtown area so you are not bombarded by non-stop stag and hen parties without it being too far to travel into the centre. Its perhaps a 15 minute walk to Dam Square. Room: Quite stylish but let down by a few basic design flaws. There is a serious lack of wardrobe / cupboard space for 2 people and little room to store suitcases or bags. The lack of a full door to the bathroom is a more serious issue. Anyone using the toilet is basically unleashing the sound and smells to anyone else in the room. Fine for a solo traveller but for 2 people not so good. The shower area in the bathroom is not fully enclosed meaning that the entire bathroom floor gets very wet when ever anyone uses the bathroom. One of my colleagues slipped in their bathroom during the stay, hardly surprising given how wet the floor was. A female colleague commented to me that in her opinion the cleanliness of bathroom wasn't all it could be either. The free wif-fi is fast and easy to connect to. The Stairs: I read a few reviews on tripadvisor before I left and had dismissed the complaints about the stairs as being from our Americans friends not used to European accommodation. I was very very wrong. The stairs are VERY steep and have very narrow turns on them. I would be very nervous about anyone with any problems with stairs tackling these. I understand completely the comments about this being a typical Dutch house, however they are simply the steepest stairs I have ever seen in a hotel. It should be noted there is no lift. Breakfast: 10 Euros, its fairly good value buffet style. You can get cheaper in Amsterdam but its a decent way to start your day as the breakfast room is light and airey. Staff: I found the staff to be very helpful, although the hotel is unmanned between 7pm & 9am. We had some noise issues with very noisy guests over night during our stay and were unable to speak to anyone regarding them. I really want to like this hotel as I had an amazing time in Amsterdam, I do feel though its let down by some basic elements. Previously i've stayed in much worse hotels in Amsterdam so am loathed to write a less than positive review, sadly the bad points keep coming back to me. I'd recommend it to solo travellers only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hospitality near the Museums”
Reviews.Author: i-am-the-Driver
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the NL,and were pleased with all aspects. The location is within a half-mile stroll to the ReichsMuseum and the central Leidseplein gathering center--only 2 km. from Central train station. Tram line 3 min. walk. The room was very comfortable, but a bit pricey due to an extremely large international conference in town.--normal rates are quite competitive. Note--those with mobility limitations--there are steep "Amsterdam" stairs to climb--the NL is a resored Dutch townhouse with only 13 rooms. The morning breakfast is a good value for 10 Euro--there are other good choices a 5 min. walk to the Leidseplein area. Finally, the in-room coffee was the best I've ever had!! If you're lucky, you will have Henk and Kate to assist you.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderfultime in NL-Hotel”
Reviews.Author: defhedkon
Reviews.Content: If you look for a Hotel, that is situated in the Centre of Amsterdam, clean, stylish and with helpful and friendly staff NL-Hotel is the right place for you! We felt very welcomed...just like home! The staff is very friendly and even remembered our names, which made us feel not just simple tourists! They recommended restaurants, bars, clubs, and exhibitions. Our room was clean and silent. The bed very comfortable! We had such a good time there! Defenetly coming back! Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “a small jewel of a hotel ..... fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: a2-idesign
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Very convenient to all major attractions of Amsterdam. The boys were very friendly and helpful. The room was fantastic, very well designed and comfortable. The bed was great... If I weren't on vacation and had a limited time in Amsterdam I would have stayed in bed all morning.... Best way to see Amsterdam is to rent a bike (visit Mikes Bike tours).

Reviews.Title: “Dutch hotels”
Reviews.Author: kieks
Reviews.Content: Location near Munt Tower and flowermarket very very good. Breakfast terrific but you have to ask for the discounted price - nobody will tell you freely that it is only Euro 15 and not 25 as stated at the frontdesk. Rooms are very nice for a city hotel. People at front desk not too friendly - all foreigners that do not speak Dutch

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: cub28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my boyfriend, and we had a great welcome by friendly receptionist. We stayed in room 4 (ground floor) very quite and nice designed garden room, loved the bathtub! Breakfast was ok, but what you expact10â‚¬. I will sure visit nl hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiinaNIK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NL for 3 nights in early April. The location was excellent, really close everywhere where we wanted to go. First problem we encountered was already on arrival. There is no reception after 9 o'clock! Luckkily one of was arrived just in time otherwise there would have been a 15e extra charge for "late" check-in!!! This really wasn't mentioned on the website when making the reservation! Also the pictures on their website have been taken with some wide angle lense, the hotel and the rooms were REALLY small! I was travelling with a friend and requested a twin room. The hotel replied that they have no twins, only doubles. Fair enough. What they forgot to mention is that none of the double beds are full size!! The bed was only 140cm wide and there was just one blanket for us to share!! That's what I have for me alone at home! Now that would be fine with a significant other but with a friend - I don't think so! Especially when we are both quite large size people. We did get another blanket when requested but the bed still stayed the same... Another thing which was a bit embarrassing when travelling with a friend was the bathroom doors: there was no proper door, just a glass doors through which you could easily see and hear everything that went on inside! Not for the shy ones...Also the room was so tiny there was no space to open suitcases and the only table space was the small night stands. I mean it would be ok for 1 night but 2 girls on a 3-day shopping spree??!! But the receptionist Juan really made up for everything. He was so welcoming and nice. Also we really liked the decor of the place, very nice and modern. Only the stairs were really really steep inside and outside. Also this would have been nice to have known in advance. Our room (nr10) was really quiet on the garden side, we woke to bird song in the mornings! Breakfast was not included in room price, it was 10e and quite adequate. Overall a nice small hotel, but we were really taken aback how much the website description differed from reality.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you can - Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: powermikey
Reviews.Content: The people who run this hotel are dishonest and go against their word. The hotel is misrepresented. It's noisy, hot, dirty, and the stairs are dangerous. I made the mistake of staying there once. I will never again. Staff is not nice and you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: Great 13 rooms Hotel with excellent receptionist, Juan! The only minus point is if you are given a room on the grouns floor, room 5 or 6, they are not very good if you want to sleep till late. You can hear every person arriving, leaving or coming down the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Shoobysue
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it looked very modern, the rooms were not the same as in the picture, just basic but with a nice bathroom. I found it a bit far out from the Red light and Dam square, the stairs were extremely steep. The first night we got there at 9.30pm and had to ring a bell and the man came 5 minutes later on his bike and checked us in, we were at the front of the hotel in the basement so you could hear all the traffic from the road and people in the street, in the morning at around 7.30am you could here all the plates clashing and the breakfast being put out as we were right below the breakfast room and kitchen, then there was lots more noise coming from next door (another kitchen) and we could hear water like a shower against our wall and a lot of banging this went on for over an hour. When we spoke to the reception they said they had a blockage in one of the toilets so the plumber was there to fix this, no compensation given. Would not recommend this hotel as it is hard to find a bit out of the way and too noisy if you get a room at the front or in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Outrageous Stairs”
Reviews.Author: bellydancer25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on business, and recommend it because the staff was very helpful and friendly, but there are a few things you should be aware of before booking. 1) the building does not have a lift, only stairs, and the stairs are literally straight up, and very narrow. I hear this is common in homes in the Netherlands, so it's probably not just this hotel. 2) it's a bit of a hike from the center of the city, but the tram can drop you close by. 3) the fire alarm went off twice in the night while we were there due to someone taking a shower and the steam set it off.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BiiBoo
Reviews.Content: First impressions were that of the extremely friendly, down-to-earth and helpful staff. After being on a 2 week tour around Europe, service with a smile was something we weren't used to. The room was great, very clean, modern and no-frills. Good views were an added bonus. Location is fantastic, less than 10min to Leidseplein and museums. There were downfalls: very steep stairs, we were lucky that the hotel staff help us carry our 25kg suitcases up and down steep and windy stairs (not for the faint-hearted). As mentioned this is a no-frills hotel so don't expect tea & coffee facilities, no room service or 24hour reception. Which was ok as I did my research an wasn't after 5-star treatment. The hotel is unstaffed after 7pm, but will provide an emergency phone number.

Reviews.Title: “Need a lift?”
Reviews.Author: bearandcub
Reviews.Content: A swish looking place although pretentious. Perhaps a pre-requisite for a "boutique" hotel? I am not too sure so maybe we need to stick to something a little more conventional in future. Check in was not available until after 2pm, that made it a long day after arriving in Amsterdam from Singapore at 6am. Negotiating the first few, and very steep stairs was awkward with our cases. We were warmly greeted by one of the owners sister, who was helping out at the time, she was really friendly and charming and provided local maps and tips. Checking into the room was a litlle more challenging, we have never seen such steep, narrow stairs with a wind at the top before. Whatever you do, please make sure that you have not been visiting one of the local "coffee shops" or had a beer too many before attempting to carry your luggage up these stairs. The stairs are dizzying, and we spent our stay with the concern of getting our cases back down when it was time to leave. The room was small and very basic, too much attention to presentation rather than guest needs or requirements. The bathroom was uncomfortable to use, and more privacy would not have gone amiss when considering the design of this room. Even though you are advised in advance of the lack of availability of the staff, and accept that this is OK, the expectation is that there will be no problems during the stay. Needless to say we had issues (power loss) on two occasions during our 3 night stay. Things were sorted eventually but on site staff would have been appreciated to deal with things with less fuss. All in all a trendy place, nice to look at but not too practical.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a home but not too sweet”
Reviews.Author: LeniVigo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days 4 nights during my business trip. Our colleague from our Amsterdam office booked the hotel for me and my other 2 asian collegues. The hotel is like a house basically. Don't expect a wake-up call facility as you won't even find a telephone inside your room! If you need, the hotel will provide you with a cell-phone and local SIM card. The room is simple, clean (for first night! my experience was bad, they didn't clean my room from 2nd night onwards!), TV, small fridge, a safety box (which can be moved from room to room, so watch out! you won't lose anything perhaps but the event might just drive you crazy!) and standar tea-coffe making facility. Perhaps because it's still new then it's still nice. The owner and his partner were friendly and helpful but they better watch out their staffs, expecially the female staff who always came late during our stay and caused me prepared my breakfast by myself! I took the juice, cold cuts etc directly form their fridge. It was over 8.30 and that girl was just busy with other things, of course she just arrived basically! Anyway, if you are a student, perhaps this hotel is good enough since it's not too big, homey, quite. But if you are a professional who requires a service, BETTER NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Just right - NL Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NL Hotel with my sister for two nights. We really liked it and found it very suitable for our short trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is located a short walk from the Leidesplein and was very secure, with guests needing a swipe card to gain entry to the hotel at any time. The hotel decor was very tasteful; the standard of cleanliness was high; our room, while small, was very comfortable and warm and had all the facilities we needed; the bathroom was very nice, new and clean. The only negative for us was that there was a curtain instead of a door separating the bedroom from the bathroom. The reception area is staffed only between 9a.m. and 6p.m., but the owners are contactable by phone at all other times should you need assistance or require a late check-in. We found them to be very friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because we preferred to grab something as we walked. I would recommend NL Hotel and would certainly stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Madage
Reviews.Content: We booked at NL-Hotel hotel based on the reviews on this site. It would seem previous travelers don't have the same standards as us. Design : This is where they have put all their efforts and how they justify the price of the room. The clerk made sure to point out the details to us while we were checking in. They have done a good job of transforming a normal Amsterdam house in a small hotel, but get ready to carry your luggage in a tiny winding staircase. Location : The hotel is situated in a great spot of Amsterdam if you want to visit the museums and do some sight-seeing in the canals. There is an underground parking about 5 minutes away (36 euros a day !). Service : It is a small hotel, run by a few people, and you get service you would expect from a youth hostel, not a 150 euros a night hotel. It seems their schedule is more important than ours. Here are a few examples : You can't check-in after 6:00 PM if you don't have a cell phone because no one is there - there's a phone number taped in the window; If you have an emergency during the night - like trying to get in the place since our electronic key worked 1 out of 10 times on the front door and never for our room - you also need to call that number, but the clerk made it clear to us that he didn't want us to disturb him after he left. Other guests ended up opening the door for us on many occasions. The breakfast begins at 9:00 AM, which is not useful for business people or travelers, and the breakfast is poor at best - frozen bread (and being heated in a Miele oven doesn't change that), jam, cold cuts. On the only morning we ate there, the person preparing the breakfast and working the reception at the same time was late, busy on the phone and clearly just out of bed so we ended up getting our breakfast at 9:45 AM. Room : If design was the only standard, then it would be worth a 5, but if you include practicality, it drops to 0 or 1. The room is small, but the size is understandable considering you are in a converted Amsterdam house. There is almost no closet space or room to put your luggage. Not only is there no air conditioning, but also no air circulation at all. If you close the window, the room will get stuffy in a few minutes. When we opened the window, we were attacked by an army of mosquitoes that flew by our tv set and buzzed in our ears during the night - and we still have the bite marks to prove it !. It would seem previous guests had the same problem since there were many mosquito corpses splattered on the walls and ceilings. Other than that, the cleanliness of the room was ok. The bathroom is separated from the room only by a curtain, which is not practical to say the least, even for a married couple. Since there is no shower curtain or door, the entire bathroom floor gets wet after a few seconds. There is close to no shelf space in the bathroom (that's why they leave the towels on the bed each day). In conclusion, we would not go back to NL-Hotel even if they charged half the price we payed. In creating this hotel, too much attention was payed to design and not enough to the needs of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “never again...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: I've decided to choose an intimate hotel instead of a large hotel for our Madonna's concert visit in Amsterdam because i wanted a romantic place for my BF... Such a deception, such a terrible place not clean, not nice and without any service. Honnestly, we travel a lot and NL hotel is the baddest hotel we know. The receptionnist was particularly unefficient and seemed to be bored. Moreover, she wasn't dressed with clean clothes and to welcome guests without shoe is not nice. Moreover, we asked how to go to the concert and she wasn't really good to give us the information we needed. By the way, you understand the service in this hotel is under the level expected and talk now about the room. After bringing our heavy baggages by ourselves, we arrived in a very tiny space, quite ugly and extremly noisy... A view on the less charming canal of Amsterdam and the music of the road... So nice... But the worst thing is undoubtly there was absolutely no seperation from the bedroom and the toilet. It's excellent for intimacy and even if "open space" is trendy, the toilet area has to be seperated. We have been obliged to accept that because nobody was available when i wanted to ask to a manager. Moreover, how people can say this hotel is clean because it's not the case at all... Maybe they like to use a soap used by previous customers and maybe they like to find "hairs" close to the toilet and in the shower??? I'm extremly surprised NL has good comments from other customers because we promise you this is the place NOT to go in Amsterdam. About the equipment, except a large screen, there is nothing and if you want to call during the night in emergency, you have to use your cellular phone because there is no phone in the room and nobody from the staff in the building. Impressive !!! About the breakfast, just expect some bad orange juice, bread and cheese because there is honnestly nothing good. For 185 â‚¬ per night, we expected more and first of all something clean, charming and with a good staff but it was just the opposite and we are upset to have lost money in something like that.... NL Hotel = THE MOST TERRIBLE HOTEL EXPERIENCE...

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, design-conscious small hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: scottmichaelmorris
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 3 week trip to Europe which began with a 2-night stay at the nl-hotel in Amsterdam. We had a great experience -- Robert (one of the owners, who also works the front desk many days) was a really terrific guy who gave us lots of great recommendations and was just really fun to talk with. The rooms are small but very well-appointed -- sort of the "lighter" side of design, with great details but nothing over-designed. The hotel was in a very good location just outside the Canal Belt and we walked everywhere. It's also a short walk from a tram line that goes straight to Centraal Station. Overall, our experience was very good and we would definitely stay there again. Our only criticisms about the room are that the rooms could use a real closet space (the little storage area provided was tiny, with room for maybe 3 shirts on hangers and that's it) and I agree with other reviewers that the bathroom really needs a proper door and not just a curtain to separate it from the bedroom. These were small inconveniences, though, when our overall experience was very good. One note: This is a VERY small hotel with no "scene" as there is no real public space save the tiny reception area/breakfast room, which is closed from about 7pm to the following morning. So if you're looking for peace and quiet, this is a great choice, but it you're looking to be social at the hotel bar, that's tough at this hotel as there isn't one! Scott Morris, San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: ninoouk
Reviews.Content: Ultra modern and stylish hotel. The room was compact, but not a problem. Very comfortable bed, light and airy room with LCD tv and nice finishing touches. The whole room was finished to a very high standard and was really clean. The area is great and handy for getting to all of the main areas, the vondelpark, and all of the best shops and coffee shops! The guys at reception were great. Very friendly and made us feel really welcome. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place Hi Tec room”
Reviews.Author: Ofer H
Reviews.Content: Great Place, walking distance from evrywhere, welcoming and helpful atitude from all 3 guys we met at the reception, very clean and "Hi Tec" room with LCD TV but still warm atmosphere. The only problem we found was the lack of a door to the bath / toeilet room.

Reviews.Title: “NL on nassaukade Great hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a newly refurbished boutique hotel near the Leidseplein amsterdam. An award winning designer apparantley helped design it. This hotel is gorgeous beautifully finished and really clean.The bed was so comfy we struggled to get out in the morning. Lovely guy running it who was really helpful even let us check in two hours early. Hotel is small with informal atmosphere (no bar, small breakfast area -didn't have the breakfast as cost extra). If you are looking for a reasonable really nice room near tourist area of the leidsplein (only 10 min tram ride to the dam and central station area) then definately would book this. I looked at hundreads of reviews of hotels over amsterdam and the majority of the same price sounded like total hell holes. This was a really secure hotel with swipe card access to front door and room, safety deposit box in room (free). Cannot speak more highly of this place we had a great time in really lovely surroundings.

HotelInfo.Name: NL Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nassaukade 368, Amsterdam 1054 AB , The Netherlands
